trial_identification.studytitle: predictor factors of technical difficulty in laparoscopic cholecystectomy
trial_identification.scientifictitle: predictor factors of technical difficulty in laparoscopic cholecystectomy: is it possible?

conditioncode.conditioncode2: Other diseases of the mouth, teeth, oesophagus, digestive system including liver and colon

interventions.interventions: Laparoscopic cholecystectomy procedure, the outcome of 500 consecutive cases were observed for (operative, post operative complications, long time procedure, or long hospital stay) & divided accordingly to 2 groups complicated and non complicated and the pre-operative variables (e.g history, U.S, or laboratory) will be tested for significant statistical analysis
interventions.comparator: uncomplicated cases, versus the complicated cases (operative & short post -operative complications, long procedure, long hospital stay) over the early post operative course ( one month)

primaryOutcome.outcome: 1- is to define the pre - operative risk factors of a difficult procedure of laparoscopic cholecystectomy. i.e (difficult procedure means complicated cases , long hospital stay, or long procedure). Early operative post operative complication ( as haemorrhage , duct injury & ileus, etc) The cases are classified into two groups complicated and Non complicated group according to patient's sheet of preoperative operative and post operative sheet including follow up sheet, using clinical examination and assessment or radiological or endoscopic intervention when needed data entry and analysis was done using SPSS V 17, quantitative data of variables well be represented as means an SD, T test will be used to compare between means of two groups,qualitative data well be presented as numbers and percentage and compared using the Chi square test. Odds ratio and 95% confidence interval well be used to assess the risk of developing complications in relation to the studied variables. All factors proved significant association with complications by crude analysis well be entered into binary logistic regression variation analysis to determine the independent predictors of complications. P is significant if equal or less than 0.05 at confidence interval 95%.

secondaryOutcome.outcome: secondary outcome is the morbidity of the procedure over all complication rate, and single complication incidence and rate as numbers and percentage from the total sample
secondaryOutcome.timepoint: early operative post operative complication ( as haemorrhage , duct injury & ileus) within one month, late complications (as port site hernia) within 6 to 12 months

eligibility.inclusivecriteria: all cases prepared and admitted for laparoscopic cholecystectomy

ethicsAndSummary.summary: The aim of the study is to evaluate the risk factors that may reflect a technical difficulties of the popular procedure like laparscopic cholecystectomy, through identification of the complicated cases (Long procedure, conversion, early complications, or long hospital stay) and to compare with uncomplicated cases reaching may be to a score of difficulty, which may be used for surgical trainee or resident programs

ethicscommitee.ethicaddress: El-Gomhoria st, Mansoura 35516, Egypt, Surgery department

El-Gomhoria st, Mansoura 35516, Egypt,
trial was approved via local departmental ethical committee at 1/05/2008 then re-entered to the main committee in faculty of medicine
